Summary “Creating Successful Software’s with Agile and RAASUI “ 
As per a recent Gartner report, the failure rate of large IT projects with budgets exceeding $1 million was found to be almost 50%. 
http://thisiswhatgoodlookslike.com/2012/06/10/gartner-survey-shows-why-projects-fail/ 
 
As an enterprise architect (CA<​- EA<​- TA), I own the design, technology and process to deliver software within time, budget and with quality. I have an almost 90% of proven record of doing this. 
 
As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, I work effectively as the CTO of the engagement with a start-up mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to a solution evangelist. 
 
Here are some of my unique experiences and skills 
-	Key responsibilities include creating and managing enterprise software portfolio, Architecture strategy, architecture review boards, MGTP (multi-generation technology platform) and the technology roadmap for the products.  
-	Evangelize about the set of ideals and technology trends with different stakeholder including Customers, executive team and architects. 
-	An expert in building large and complex distributed systems with help of frameworks which not only allows reuse but also address cross cutting concerns based on RASSUI standard (Reliability, Availability, Serviceability, Security, Usability, and Install-ability/Integration ) 
-	Proven record of creating solutions which are SOA based with cloud, mobility and security as key elements to reduce costs, increase agility, and standardize IT environments. 
-	Author of books and articles including a best seller on Amazon. 
-	Contribute to community by speaking at various events and conference such as Tech-Ed, User groups and prestigious colleges such as BHU.

 Experience Chief Architect DevFactory February 2015  – Present (7 months) Mumbai Area, India -	Responsible for the architecture, design and delivery of an Enterprise software product in its portfolio.  
-	As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, I work effectively as the CTO of the engagement with a start-up mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product. 
-	Integrate Cloud CI and improve dev processes 
-	Optimize ROI on all products via technical solutions 
-	Migrate Legacy systems 
 Technical Evangelist Microsoft September 2012  –  February 2015  (2 years 6 months) Mumbai Area, India -	Drive adoption of windows Azure, windows phone and Xbox one in India. 
-	Work with Top business in India to define their enterprise mobile and cloud strategy. Create and Architecture and technology roadmap along with their architects and CTO’s. 
-	Architected from the scratch cloud solution as well migration solution from other platform to Windows Azure. 
-	Work with developer community to ease and accelerate the adoption of Microsoft technologies such as Windows Azure, windows phone,Kinect and Xbox one. 
- Speak at various events such as Tech-ed, Dev camps and user groups. 
-	Work with educational institutes – Indian universities like (BHU, RKU), Publishers such as (McGrawHills and Pearson) and even students to align them to key technology trends such as Big data, Cloud and Mobility. 
-	Work with Microsoft Product team to incorporate key changes and community feedback. 
 Product Architect GE Energy May 2010  –  September 2012  (2 years 5 months) Mumbai Area, India -	Architect Condition monitoring framework for MCS to be used by different product lines such as Wind Turbines, Gas turbines and power plants. 
This framework was built on SOA principles using WCF. 
-	Write Design practices for Software solutions group at GE. 
-	Built an agile team and process for working with Product lines  
-	Created the Performance and Load testing strategy 
-	Design security architecture for GE product lines based on threat model analysis.  
 Technical Architect JDA Software May 2009  –  May 2010  (1 year 1 month) Hyderabad Area, India -	Architect and develop a supply chain framework for JDA’s suite of products. 
-	Define an integration strategy for heterogeneous JDA products  
-	Create the interoperability architecture for different layers of solutions like between J2ME and Xml business objects using WSIT, between Services hosted on IBM WebSphere and WebLogic to clients consuming it on rich.net WPF frameworks 
 
 Associate Prinicipal Consultant Neudesic December 2006  –  May 2009  (2 years 6 months) - Joined as Senior consultant and got promoted to Associate Prinicipal Consultant. 
-	High end architecture consulting for top customers of Neudesic. 
-	Helped build a team of hardcore technical people at Neudesic and lead them in custom app development area. 
-	Help the sales team with estimations and POC at the beginning of project cycle 
- Written books and articles on various technologies.

Summary Technical leader with over 8 years of experience in the software industry. Successfully participated in leading complex projects, covering various aspects of software development, process and methodology. Experienced in coordinating, negotiating and motivating outside vendors and offshore resources in support of timeline and project deliverables. Extensive experience in Object-Oriented design and development, Java, J2EE, middleware and enterprise application architecture and implementation. 
My current role responsibilities include but not limited to, define or participate in defining the high level system architecture, define detailed design for different system modules, choosing the perfect technology or tool to implement different business requirements and finally provide guidance for team members. 
 
Aspired to gain the needed experiences, knowledge and skills that qualifies me to fill a chief architect position in a multinational organization.

- Unix scripting.

- JSF (RichFaces and ADF).

I have a strong track record of building products from scratch, making optimum trade offs to handle delivery and strategic engineering. I have built products, and teams, and worked with non-Engineering teams to bootstrap and function. Have worked extensively on Multi-tenanted SaaS solutions. 
 
Presently I am managing Engineering for CA's Mobile Device Management offering. I was responsible for the engineering bootstrap (including hiring, processes, planning), execution and delivery of the offering and presently manage the Engineering activities for the same.

1. Technically solid, strong command on Data Structure, Algorithms, Java and Web Technologies. Have worked extensively in Federation, Security and presently working in Enterprise Mobility Management.

3. Product Development - Have both built products from the scratch and maintained them. 
4. Holistic View - Have worked in multiple capacities in a product and can appreciate the all round perspective of product building. 
5. Competitor Analysis and Product Ideation - Analyze competitor offerings in the market, study the latest in technology stack, and come up with product road map. 
 
Technologies: 
1. Java and Web Technologies 
2. Federation 
3. Authentication and Authorization 
4. SaaS and Multi-tenancy 
5.
